meanings.definition: To break or shatter into pieces.
meanings.sent1: She accidentally brise the vase while cleaning the shelf.
meanings.sent2: The glass brise when it fell off the table.
meanings.sent3: The naughty puppy managed to brise the toy into tiny bits.
meanings.sent4: The loud music seemed to brise the silence in the room.
meanings.sent5: The earthquake caused the ground to brise apart, creating deep cracks.

meanings.definition: A ballet movement in which a dancer jumps and beats the legs together in the air.
meanings.sent1: During the ballet performance, the dancer executed a perfect brise.
meanings.sent2: The brise added a touch of elegance to the dance routine.
meanings.sent3: The little ballerina's brise made the audience smile with delight.
meanings.sent4: Her brise was so graceful, it seemed like she was floating in the air.
meanings.sent5: The brise was the highlight of the ballet, showcasing the dancer's skill and agility.

meanings.sent1: The sudden brise blew the leaves off the trees.
meanings.sent2: We could hear the howl of the brise outside the window.
meanings.sent3: The playful children ran against the brise, laughing as it pushed them back.
meanings.sent4: The brise carried the scent of fresh flowers through the open window.
meanings.sent5: The brise swept through the town, cooling the hot summer air.
